definition: (of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Young scene seize turned separate yeongjo, want to notice him about plucking exceedingly senti-mental secrets.
sentences.chinese: 幼景抓住轉身分開的英祖，要通知他關於寒星的機密。

sentences.english: Before I could answer, she had turned around and started back out onto the field.
sentences.chinese: 我還未來得及回話，她已經轉身向足球場上走去了。

sentences.english: Then Tom turned coolly away, still talking, and took Amy with him.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆冷冰冰地轉身帶着艾美走了，邊走邊和她談着。

sentences.english: He turned to look. He saw a 7-foot grizzly bear charge towards him.
sentences.chinese: 他轉身一看，看見一隻7英尺高的灰熊向他衝來。

sentences.english: Jade bead met Liu Wenkai when we were waiting for the car, she turned and walked.
sentences.chinese: 玉珠在等車的時候遇到劉文凱，她轉身就走。

sentences.english: Turned free and easy of go away, let figure burger in your mind.
sentences.chinese: 轉身灑脫的走開，讓你的頭腦中留下美圖漢堡的印象。

sentences.english: Just as I start to turn back home I hear it: the soft, two-toned whistle of chickadees .
sentences.chinese: 就在我轉身要回去時，我聽到了兩聲輕輕的山雀啼叫。

sentences.english: Fatso took offense to this, spun around and bit the 36-year-old man on his right leg.
sentences.chinese: 胖子採取攻擊並且轉身咬了這位36歲男子的右腿。

sentences.english: Our instructor turned around to go back and turn the lights back on.
sentences.chinese: 我們的老師轉身過去走到後面想把燈都打開。

sentences.english: They turned and ran towards him as he came trotting to meet them.
sentences.chinese: 她們轉身向熊跑去，熊也小跑着來迎接她倆。

sentences.english: Otis asked, and turned to see three dizzy bullfrogs. 'Well, of course I did!
sentences.chinese: 奧蒂斯問道，並轉身看着三隻暈乎乎的牛蛙。

sentences.english: There isn’t much room left to turn and move, and there is less amniotic fluid.
sentences.chinese: 沒有充足的空間讓嬰兒轉身和移動了，羊水也少了。

sentences.english: Rather than flashily smash against the wall, why not elegantly turn a corner? Give yourself the space to make a turnaround.
sentences.chinese: 要華麗撞牆不如優雅轉身，給自己一個迂迴的空間。

sentences.english: Then Zhao Gao turned to other officials and asked them whether it was a horse.
sentences.chinese: 趙高轉身問其他官員這是馬還是鹿。

sentences.english: I turned in alarm as the wind blew the door open.
sentences.chinese: 當風把窗吹開的時候我驚慌地轉身。

sentences.english: She turned and went back towards her house, and I walked on to Baskerville Hall.
sentences.chinese: 她轉身往回走往，我便繼續向巴斯克維爾莊園走往。

definition: to leave/to exit
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
at once/immediately/promptly/swiftly
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to depart/to leave
to bow the head/to yield/to give in
to wave (one's hand)
immediately/suddenly
promptly/at once
hurriedly/without delay
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
just now/a moment ago
at this time/at this moment
to nod
